title: How to Make a Sand Cast Bronze Sculpture

steps.headline: Use coke, charcoal, or propane to create enough heat to melt a small amount of bronze.
steps.description: Start out with a small piece a few inches tall to practice.

steps.headline: Make an object in clay or dry wood and pack dry sand around it.
Prepare your area for work by clearing unneeded objects.
Put a layer of dry sand on the floor.
steps.description: This prevents the molten bronze or the crucible from exploding, which it will do if it touches concrete or any surface that has moisture in it.

steps.headline: Remove your clay object from the dry sand (or, if you used wood, it can be left in the mold to burn up) and then put the sand mold in a kiln.
Heat the bronze in the crucible to about 2,100 °F (1,150 °C), or until it is obviously liquid.
Using tongs, carefully pour the bronze into the sand mold (the mold should be preheated to 1000 degrees F).
Let it cool for a few hours, then take the bronze piece out of the mold.
File and sand the piece until it is how you want it.
Polish the bronze to whatever finish you desire.
steps.description: You may also paint it with a patina or regular paint.

text: Use coke, charcoal, or propane to create enough heat to melt a small amount of bronze. Start out with a small piece a few inches tall to practice. Make an object in clay or dry wood and pack dry sand around it.  Prepare your area for work by clearing unneeded objects.  Put a layer of dry sand on the floor. This prevents the molten bronze or the crucible from exploding, which it will do if it touches concrete or any surface that has moisture in it. Remove your clay object from the dry sand (or, if you used wood, it can be left in the mold to burn up) and then put the sand mold in a kiln.  Heat the kiln up to 1,000 °F (538 °C).  Heat the bronze in the crucible to about 2,100 °F (1,150 °C), or until it is obviously liquid.  Using tongs, carefully pour the bronze into the sand mold (the mold should be preheated to 1000 degrees F).  Let it cool for a few hours, then take the bronze piece out of the mold.  File and sand the piece until it is how you want it.  Polish the bronze to whatever finish you desire. You may also paint it with a patina or regular paint.
